location.physicalLocation: British Library: India Office Records and Private Papers

titleInfo.title: Letter No 5 of 1823 from John Macleod, Resident in the Persian Gulf to Francis Warden, Chief Secretary to the Government, Political Department, Bombay

mods.abstract: The letter is informing the Bombay Government that the Resident does not agree with Captain French's view that a cruizer should be left at Bushire, as he cannot spare one from watching the 'pirate ports'. It also mentions that the Resident has not been able to verify the reports that the British Ambassador has departed from Tehran.
